parameters.pythonCode:
# Define keyword lists
negatives = [
    # Customer service complaints
    "complaint","complaints","poor service","bad service","customer service","support issue","unhelpful","rude","ignored",
    "waited","delay","delayed","long wait","hold","no response","no reply","unanswered",
    
    # Product / quality issues
    "broken","not working","doesn't work","stopped working","faulty","defective","damaged",
    "low quality","cheap","poor quality","bad quality","useless","worthless","trash","garbage",
    "fake","counterfeit","knockoff","shady","scam","fraud","rip-off","overpriced","overcharged",

    # Technical issues / reliability
    "bug","glitch","error","crash","failed","failure","downtime","outage","offline","lag","slow",
    "server down","service down","cannot connect","connection lost","timeout","unstable",
    
    # Financial issues
    "refund","no refund","stolen","charged twice","hidden fee","billing error","unauthorized charge",
    "scammed","cheated","money lost","ripoff","penalty","fine",
    
    # Security / legal
    "hack","hacked","hacking","phishing","data breach","leak","exploit","malware","virus","spyware","ransomware",
    "lawsuit","illegal","criminal","guilty","corruption","bribery","fraudulent",
    
    # Emotional / strong negatives
    "hate","angry","frustrated","annoyed","irritated","disappointed","disappointing","unsatisfied","unhappy",
    "worst","awful","horrible","terrible","disaster","disgusting","pathetic","shame","embarrassing","toxic",
    
    # Reputation / trust
    "boycott","negative review","bad review","one star","0 stars","scandal","controversy","backlash","protest",

    # Education quality (negative)
    "poor teaching","bad teaching","uninspiring lectures","boring classes","low academic standard",
    "outdated curriculum","lack of research","poor facilities","bad professors","incompetent lecturers",
    
    # Job prospects (negative)
    "unemployed graduates","no jobs","poor career prospects","low employment rate","difficult to find work",
    "graduates struggle","useless degree","unmarketable skills","not employable"
]


positives = [
    # Customer service praise
    "helpful","kind","friendly","supportive","responsive","fast service","quick reply","attentive","professional","excellent service",
    
    # Product / quality praise
    "amazing","great","fantastic","excellent","outstanding","superb","wonderful","brilliant","love","best","perfect",
    "impressive","awesome","beautiful","high quality","premium","durable","reliable","top-notch","world-class",
    
    # Experience / emotions
    "happy","satisfied","pleased","delighted","excited","thrilled","grateful","thank you","thanks","appreciate",
    "recommend","recommended","five stars","5 stars","positive review","good review","loyal customer",
    
    # Performance / reliability
    "fast","speedy","smooth","easy","works perfectly","flawless","seamless","efficient","powerful",
    
    # Value / trust
    "worth it","valuable","affordable","fair price","reasonable","trusted","reliable","dependable","secure","safe",
    
    # Strong emotional positives
    "love it","love this","game changer","next level","lifesaver","best ever","excellent job","amazing work",

    # Education quality (positive)
    "world-class education","excellent teaching","inspiring professors","engaging lectures","cutting-edge curriculum",
    "strong academics","high academic standard","innovative research","great facilities","outstanding lecturers",
    
    # Job prospects (positive)
    "high employment rate","graduates succeed","great career prospects","job ready","strong alumni network",
    "employable skills","highly employable","successful graduates","career opportunities","industry connections"
]

output = []

for item in items:  # loop over incoming items
    news_list = item["json"].get("news", [])
    for news in news_list:
        text = f"{news.get('title','')} {news.get('snippet','')}".lower()
        sentiment = "neutral"

        if any(word in text for word in negatives):
            sentiment = "negative"
        elif any(word in text for word in positives):
            sentiment = "positive"

        output.append({
            "json": {
                "title": news.get("title", ""),
                "snippet": news.get("snippet", ""),
                "link": news.get("link", ""),
                "sentiment": sentiment
            }
        })

# Must return list of dicts for n8n
return output
